title: Something is really wrong with the state of this game..
body:
https://imgur.com/2p0KzFO

The top page of the gameplay section is filling up with unhappy people about the entire state of the game.  I know that people look at the boards and think that it's a low % of the total community, and thus complaints shouldn't be taken too seriously.. but this isn't normal.

Since season 3 I've been here, and I've never seen so many people complain about the game as a whole. Yes, of course people will complain about OP champs, OP items, ranked matchmaking, etc.. but never the entire game.

These changes are very unwelcomed.. and I do respect trying new things out, and trying to make a great game better.  At the same time though, I think you have a mild obligation to keep certain aspects we enjoy, or at least change them slowly and one thing at a time. Its safe to say that all these new things were thrown at us all at once, and it's easy to deal with 1-2 things you don't like, but it's almost not worth it to deal with 5-6 things when there are so many other games available to play. It's easy to ignore the few people quitting the game, or protesting certain things, because of how many other players there are... however, from all my forum surfing, the amount of people I see defending these changes, and especially with logic or reason, is slim to none.

I wish you wouldn't look at us as customers, and more like family or friends.. the majority of us who are still here, want to see this game work, but it's a two-way street. There is no shame in saying "Ok, we tried something out, it didn't work, let's revert it back to normal and work on another idea." Sometimes I feel like Riot becomes too proud to say they made a bad move, and instead of owning up to it, they drag it out, hoping that we'll like it one day, and eventually when our hatred for it reaches a certain level they finally fix the problem before they lose thousands of people. (*cough dynamic queue*)

Anyways, I hope the forums don't go unnoticed just because it's a low % of the community.  In a way, our opinions should mean something a little more because we take the time out of our day to come here and post something that will help the entirety of the game.  Whether it's complaints, or suggestions, or even memes.. we post here to make the game better or to bring more enjoyment from it. Don't ignore us :^)



TLDR: Too many people unhappy with current state of game.  Riot needs to man up sometimes, admit they made a mistake, fix it quickly, and work on the next big thing. The people who are still here playing, are proving their loyalty to Riot, and league.. and just want everyone to be happy in the long run. Oh, and don't ignore the forum peoples :)

I started playing ranked again, usually I don't during preseason or just play 1-2 games every 2-3 weeks, but after I've seen the current game state and the meta, I completely agree with all the posts about it here.

First blood, first tower are pretty much winning the game. I completely agree now that that the bot lane that wins (and I'm not tlaking about good stats) are winning the game. Kind of annoying how this game turned out and I really hope someone with power at Riot, and not the support staff and developers, take some responsibility and raise some voice. Because if this shit keeps going on, people will really start clicking uninstall soon and won't consider coming back.
Saying winning Botlane wins the game sounds like a small mindset to the game honestly.
Well it's confirmed by many others, I didn't wanna believe it too but it's actually a big chunk truth

I would imagine that when bot lane gets repeatedly roamed on and ganked by one team and the other team didn't take actions to balance it out, the first team which got 3-4 out of 5 players ahead while setting 2 opponents greatly behind would win more often.

So much this. It frustrates me that people forget that botlane is 40% of your team. If 40% of your team is behind, and the other 60% aren't ahead, you are going to have a bad time. This realization was one of the reasons I became a support main (that and I couldn't stand autofilled supports and the toxicity that comes when no one trades). If I do well (which means my ADC did at least a halfway decent job), I have a 40% impact instead of a 20% impact on the game during the laning phase. I'm actually surprised ADC and Support aren't the two most popular roles because of this.

I think the issue isn't that bot lane is important so much as how much easier it is to impact the lane than it was in earlier seasons.

It's not that it has suddenly become more important, it's how much easier it is to effect it.

Especially that many good supports have been nerfed either directly or by their core items, which allows this to happen. Jungle or any lane that comes to help bot lane is pretty much successful. Supports now don't have that extra power to protect the ADC and themselves so that they survive on kind of unexpected ganks.

I feel like this perfectly sums up Riot's mindset since their inception, the difference back then being that they never forced out such massive changes at one time. They will see the community universally agree on how bad an upcoming change in the works is but Riot will force it out anyway. People will continue expressing how bad it was and how right they are, but Riot will double down on it anyway. Let's take a look back at Kalista's creation for an example, shall we? This was way back when the ADC issue was actually becoming a thing and the community first started talking about them as a problem. Riot saw us point at how badly ADCs were starting to crush melee champs, how the mobile ADCs had going top lane handicapped in their favor, etc. ...and what did Riot do? They went on to make a champion with permanent mobility as her passive at zero the cost. The community went batshit crazy over it when she hit PBE and shouted at how broken that was for any champion... then riot doubled down on it... then they released her... then she dominated games... then she was forced to get nerfed into the ground...

Riot doesn't like admitting they made mistakes...
